name: relationship
title: Relationship
description: A specification for a relationship of a subject entity to a related entity.

fields.name: relationshipID
fields.title: Relationship ID
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: subjectResourceID
fields.title: Subject Resource ID
fields.description: An identifier for the resource that is the subject of a Relationship.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: subjectResourceType
fields.title: Subject Resource Type
fields.description: A category that best matches the nature of a subject resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary consisting of the classes of resources that can be related to each other.

fields.name: subjectResourceTypeIRI
fields.title: Subject Resource Type IRI
fields.description: An IRI of a controlled vocabulary value for the type of a subject resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: subjectResourceTypeVocabulary
fields.title: Subject Resource Type Vocabulary
fields.description: A reference to a controlled vocabulary in which the definition of a value in subjectResourceType is given.

fields.name: relationshipType
fields.title: Relationship Type
fields.description: A relationship of a subject resource (identified by subjectResourceID) to a related resource (identified by relatedResourceID).
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: relationshipTypeIRI
fields.title: Relationship Type IRI
fields.description: An IRI of a controlled vocabulary value for the type of a Relationship.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: relationshipTypeVocabulary
fields.title: Relationship Type Vocabulary
fields.description: A reference to a controlled vocabulary in which the definition of a value in relationshipType is given.

fields.name: relatedResourceID
fields.title: Related Resource ID
fields.description: An identifier for the related resource (the object) of a Relationship.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: relatedResourceType
fields.title: Related Resource Type
fields.description: A category that best matches the nature of a related resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary consisting of the classes of resources that can be related to each other.

fields.name: relatedResourceTypeIRI
fields.title: Related Resource Type IRI
fields.description: An IRI of a controlled vocabulary value for a type of related resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: relatedResourceTypeVocabulary
fields.title: Related Resource Type Vocabulary
fields.description: A reference to a controlled vocabulary in which the definition of a value in relatedResourceType is given.

fields.name: relationshipOrder
fields.title: Relationship Order
fields.description: A numerical position of a Relationship in a set of Relationships that have the same combination of subjectResourceID, relatedResourceID, relationshipType, relationshipType, and relationshipTypeVocabulary.
fields.comments: One could use relationshipOrder to create an ordered list of authors for a Reference, for example. The first would have relationshipOrder=1, the second would have relationshipOrder=2.

fields.name: relationshipAccordingTo
fields.title: Relationship According To
fields.description: A name of an Agent responsible for asserting a Relationship.
fields.examples: `Jos√© E. Crespo`; `Oliver P. Pearson | Anita K. Pearson`; `FMNH`

fields.name: relationshipAccordingToID
fields.title: Relationship According To ID
fields.description: An identifier for an Agent responsible for asserting a Relationship.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: relationshipEffectiveDate
fields.title: Relationship Effective Date
fields.description: A date on which a Relationship was established.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.
fields.examples: `14:07-06:00` (2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC); `08:40:21Z` (8:40:21am UTC); `13:00:00Z/15:30:00Z` (the interval between 1pm UTC and 3:30pm UTC)

fields.name: relationshipRemarks
fields.title: Relationship Remarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a Relationship.
